entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 13).
entry.content:
When the kAppServiceStorage flag is enabled, AppService blocks the

app publishers creating until it's ready, after reading from the

AppStorage file. This affects some tests.



Modify the test code to wait for AppServiceProxy to be ready after

reading the AppStorage file in the test setup phase.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506





Change-Id: I2e61177411d3a74a0ac8a243b7288120b28e7daf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5124812

Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia

We remove the buildflag because it has caused a lot of issues when

we forget to check if the code compiles on Fuchsia for example.



Instead, we build the files on all Desktop operating systems and

make sure that the `SearchEngineChoiceService` is only initialized

on the operating systems in which we want to display the screen.

entry.title: Make edge carets for atomic inline blocks painted by their container
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/c/3620254, it became possible to have carets

before or after a non-editable inline-level element, if there was

nowhere else to place the caret without crossing into the non-editable

element. Before this, all carets inside an inline formatting context

would have been placed at a text offset, rather than at the edges of

an element.



When `CaretDisplayItemClient` computes the caret rectangle for a caret

position, it also computes the containing block that should paint it,

and it does that by using the caret's layout object if it's a

`LayoutBlock`, or its containing block if it isn't. For carets at the

edges of non-editable atomic inline blocks (e.g. inline-block,

inline-flex...), this gets the wrong result, since the layout object

is a `LayoutBlock`, but the caret should be painted by the inline

formatting context's containing block. In those cases, the caret ends

up not being painted.



The method in `CaretDisplayItemClient` that computes the painter block

doesn't know whether the caret is at the edge or inside an atomic

inline block, and so it can't know whether to use its containing

block. However, `LocalCaretRect` also contains a root box fragment,

whose layout object seems to match the computed painter block, except

that for carets at the edges of atomic inline blocks where it is the

inline formatting context's container.



This patch changes the code that computes the painter block to use

the root box fragment's layout object, if the root box fragment is

non-null, and uses the old algorithm to compute the painter block

otherwise. It also adds DCHECKs to make sure the behavior doesn't

change for cases other than atomic inline blocks, and to ensure that

the invariant of the painter block being either the caret's layout

block or its direct container keeps being held.



Bug: 1499405

Change-Id: Id552035b56a7bd51c4f90029801e9d3f52bb765f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5110302

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Koji Ishii

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238390}

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapiWrapper: Don't hold lock in encoding functions
entry.content:
vaMapBuffer() on encoded chunk is blocked until the encoding is

complete. It takes a few of hundreds milliseconds on old intel devices

because the encoding is performed using a sheder in GPU and thus is

impacted rendering workload. This likely happens on old chromebox (e.g.

puff) because it is connected to high resolution monitor like 2K.



The global vaapi lock is held while the encoder is blocked. Therefore,

it also blocks other vaapi works e.g. video decoders, MJPEG decoders,

and other video encoder in case of simulcast. The blocked vaapi works

are being accumulated and it also delays itself encoding the next

frame. It results a lot of pending frames in the encoder queue and a

user observes long delay in screen sharing.



This CL mitigates the issue by not holding the global vaapi lock if a

VA-API driver is a thread-safe in DownloadFromVABuffer() and

UploadVideoFrameToSurface(), GetEncodedChunkSize(), which are used

mainly by video encoders.



Bug: b:298660336

Test: screen sharing in Google Meet on puff

Change-Id: I0b809fc1a275cfc3451f9da7b722582b36fe963f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5098607

Reviewed-by: Justin Green

Commit-Queue: Hirokazu Honda

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238386}

entry.title: bind_internal.h cleanup: Clarify param binding constraints.
entry.content:
I struggled to understand some of the existing constraints because their

implementations often combined "condition we want to check" and "bypass

conditions under which that check shouldn't be performed". The

fundamental goal here is to try to hoist the bypasses up one level to

the structs doing static assertion, and have the variables down in the

BindArgument struct be more minimal and well-scoped.



I also removed some of the comments which now seemed redundant with the

type name + implementation + static assertion messages.



Bug: none

entry.title: webauthn: use JSON to communicate with Play Services.
entry.content:
When CredMan is enabled on Android 14, Clank sends JSON into CredMan,

and receives JSON in response. However, for Android 13 and below CredMan

doesn't exist and so we communicate with Play Services directly.

However, that means that we have two different serialisation formats,

and that the Android ‚â§13 one will be increasingly untested.



This change sends JSON into Play Services, and handles JSON if Play

Services responds with it. Where there are still some fields outside of

the JSON (which are Bundle values in CredMan), the bulk of the

complexity is unified and, hopefully, we can drop the majority of the

Play Services serialisation code in time. This also means that we can

stop adding to the serialisation code: we only need to update JSON

serialisation now.



While the JSON functions are well tested, this change is broadly

untestable because it connects JSON to Play Services and our standard

testing frameworks don't cover Chrome‚ÜîPlay Services interactions well.

At least, in time, it'll reduce the amount of such code however!



The test testMakeCredential_noEligibleParameters2() is dropped because

it sets an invalid enum value. That wasn't caught previously, but the

Mojo code doesn't accept it and, anyway, we should have confidence in

our invariants and that invalid structures aren't getting passed around.



Low-Coverage-Reason: see above.

Change-Id: I67bddd5b4d93cb8805c98833f418fd87f1d601db

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5124672

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

Auto-Submit: Adam Langley

Commit-Queue: Ken Buchanan

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1238370}

entry.title: [DTC] Use TokenHolder to block tab strip transition
entry.content:
Add a way to block tab strip transition using TokenHolder. This is helpful for UI that doesn't interact well with the transition e.g. ToolbarTablet's button visibility animations. More clients of this API will be added in follow up CLs.



This implementation still keeps the 200ms delay from the last #onLayout pass from the ControlContainer as an internal blocker.



More details for the design see design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AoTOVrA-5T7dPfRG7X3xVkjWmmJ5q6kBXg024cvlUS8/edit?resourcekey=0-3vNxjwqPaXGSa1Geo6JQyg&tab=t.0#bookmark=id.hck4u3xlw3tx



Bug: 1498252, 1508996

entry.content:

entry.title: Prepare [hidden] elements for future animations in compose
entry.content:
The style module cr-hidden-style stamps an !important on its CSS [1],

which overrides any animations that update the `display` property.

Removing the use of cr-hidden-style and applying `display: none`

manually will allow us to apply fade out animations that alter the

opacity and the display of these elements.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/webui/resources/cr_elements/cr_hidden_style.css;drc=3e1a26c44c024d97dc9a4c09bbc6a2365398ca2c;l=14

entry.title: Make tearing off a web app url tab open as app window
entry.content:
This CL makes tearing off a tab that's displaying a site handled by

an installed web app create an app window instead of a browser window.



This behavior is guarded by tear-off-web-app-tab-opens-web-app-window

flag, which defaults to off currently. Some of the interactive ui

tests are parameterized by the flag, to test both code paths.

entry.title: [Element Capture] handle elements ineligible for restriction
entry.content:
This patch causes elements that are not eligible for Element Capture to

not add an element capture compositing reason, effectively pausing the

captured stream and not generating frames. As part of this eligibility

logic update, the element is no longer forced into a stacking context

and is only captured if it already in a stacking context.



Bug: 1418194, b/291602746

entry.title: Editing: Avoid enum->String->enum conversions in InputEvent::Create*Input()
entry.content:
Create*Input() takes an `InputType` parameter. They convert it to a

string to pass it via `InputEventInit`. `InputEvent` constructor

converts the string value in the `InputEventInit` to an enum again.

entry.title: Rebuild SavedTabGroupBar OverflowMenu on model changes.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the menu would be hidden on model changes. This can cause some pretty wacky bugs on Mac if that is done during an OS drag and drop session.



Instead, keep the overflow menu open, and update its contents and size accordingly.



Two adjacent cleanup things:

- Remove the OnDragDone override; OnDragDone is called on the source view of the drag, not on the current host of the drag, when the drag ends, so it doesn't make sense for SavedTabGroupBar to override it.

- Reset the drag_data_ instead of releasing it so we don't leak it.



Bug: 1503271

entry.title: Support touch mode for EyeDropper
entry.content:
The view can be moved by either mouse or touch, so the timer which

is syncing to cursor position will keep track of previous cursor

position and will only call UpdatePosition() if cursor has moved.



Initial position is set to center of screen for CrOS tablet-mode.



When first opened, view will (re)paint once screen is captured, rather

than relying on mouse events to force first paint. This is needed

for tablets to ensure we get a first paint without requiring touch.



Bug: b/316075687

Change-Id: Ied7684775028a8f7800182ae9020e68eb00c061e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5119429

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

Commit-Queue: Joel Hockey

entry.title: Add #blendColorsMultiply, deprecate overloaded #getColorWithOverlay.
entry.content:
Previous #getColorWithOverlay with considerOpacity true would have

surprising results when from and to colors contained alpha. Often

animations including a fade between two colors would have a surprising

color in the middle, either too light or dark. Visually you could tell

something was wrong.



This new method converts to pre-multiplied alpha color channel values

before performing interpolation. This fixes the problem because the

source's alpha now weights the channel value, instead of just

inheriting the interpolated alpha fully. See the linked URL in the code

for a more detailed explanation.



Bug: 1485217, 1511721

Change-Id: I2bdf69fc2cf6a654f78b60568ab65c69462c9c49

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5121033

Commit-Queue: Sky Malice

entry.title: [A11y] No calls to GetOrCreate() unless processing deferred events
entry.content:
- Assert that GetOrCreate() is only called while processing

deferred events.

- At other times, e.g. when the tree is frozen, we should just be using

Get(), because the tree is already complete, and because it is unsafe

to modify the tree structure at that time anyway.



This helps prepare for CL:5020124, where we will remove GetOrCreate()

calls that only take a node (a parent will be required). That signature

will be removed because AXObjects will only be created when adding them

from the top down. Ultimately, this helps move toward the goal of

never needing to "repair" a tree with missing parents.



A follow-up will be to replace calls to SafeGet() with Get(), since

they now do the same thing.



Bug: none

Change-Id: I21c473ed5a0f3420111bafcf163c8a0ec576b147

entry.title: [ChromeVox]: makes Search-based shortcuts work with pass through mode
entry.content:
Pass through mode in ChromeVox (Search+Shift+Esc) allows users to pass through the next shortcut to the system.



In the distant past (ChromeVox Classic era), this worked more generally

because the ChromeVox modifier wasn't just Search (was

Ctrl+Alt/Command).



After Classic, we didn't really revisit this path when ChromeVox's

modifier became just Search.



This patch addresses the issue wherein a user presses Search+Shift+Esc followed by a partial ChromeVox shortcut e.g. Search+Esc (task manager).

ChromeVox has to ensure all held keys of the passs through shortcut are lifted (including Search) before trying to track the pass through command.



Finally, we disallow pass through while sticky mode is enabled. Sticky

mode automatically sets Search as held for all keys and leads to

unhandled states. For example, one can get into a state where Search

stops working.



R=akihiroota@chromium.org



Bug: 1511776

Test: manually trigger shortcuts (Search+Shift+Esc, Search+L).

entry.title: Use the chromium::import! macro to explicitly depend on 1p crates
entry.content:
This makes dependencies explicit in code so that:

- Crate names do not need to be unique across the entire Chromium

codebase. Instead, the whole GN path contributes to the name.

- Users of crates can specify them by their GN paths instead of by

some other globally unique naming scheme.

- Tooling can find unused dependencies in GN files and remove them.



This is built on the same idea as what google3 is planning internally

with a google3::import! macro that uses bazel paths. Googlers may see

also http://go/rust-import for internal docs on the same idea.



At the moment the macro is only used for 1p code, since 3p code needs

to have unique names within the cargo ecosystem and 3p crates need to

depend on each other by those names.



All 1p crates (except 2 below) are given unique mangled names that

include their full GN path, then the `import!` macro is able to find

and import them without ambiguity, even if their local GN target

names collide. For instance //a:foo and //b:foo can both be imported

by the `import!` macro and given different names in the importing

module.



There are 2 crates which are auto-imported and do not need to use the

macro (and thus have a globally unique name):

- chromium: this is imported into all 1p crates and provides the

import! macro.

- rust_gtest_interop: this is imported into all test() targets and

provides the gtest macro.



Care is taken to remove the crate name mangling from the generated

file names. This is good for file name length restrictions. But it's

also important for rules that refer to other rules by their target.

The unit tests linking requires adding /WHOLEARCHIVE to the command

line with the path of the rlib, and if the name is mangled then it

gets that wrong. As such, we move output_name renaming up to the

cargo_crate rule, and let other rust targets generate an output file

based on just the target name (which is normal and like c++). This

was not possible before since rlibs were all placed in

root_output_dir, but that is no longer the case, they are now placed

in the target_output_dir, ensuring uniqueness without mangling the

file name.



Change-Id: Ie2fc4ec00c9d7b4adca5c5d5efa70bb20e4ba63e

entry.title: Update Lacros test retry logic
entry.content:
We redirect user-data-dir to the logs dir where infra can upload

logs.

The logic needs to create a unique user-data-dir across all test runners.

Using test name as folder name is usually enough. But there are edge

cases it needs to handle:

* Test retry. On bots, usually we retry 1 time for test failures.

* Flakiness endorser. It will run new tests 20 times to ensure

it's not flaky.

* Developer modified builder config. Developer may modify infra

to run a test multiple times(e.g. 100) on bot to check flakiness.

To handle those edge cases, we would create the user-data-dir

using some randomly numbers to ensure it's unique.



Bug: 1478586

Test: Tested with http://crrev.com/c/5115947 tryjob

https: //ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-chromeos-rel/1814153/overview

entry.title: Vizdbg: Fix bug that caused player to randomly pause
entry.content:
It turned out this was occuring when the framebuffer filled up after

about 1 minute of frames had come in. This was because simply creating

a new DrawFrame would actually trigger an update to the

UI in that case, and then also advance the Player forward one frame.

But advancing forward one frame also paused the Player.



I decided to cleanup the Player/Viewer/Drawframe code a bit so

this weird control flow should be easier to avoid. All code related

to changing the current frame should now live in the Player.



The logic in Player was simplified a bit.



Bug: None

entry.title: [Autofill] Show save-card prompt when formless form navigates
entry.content:
This CL changes AutofillAgent to show the save-card prompt when a

user fills out a page with s but no
and navigates it.



Previously, formless submission was detected if:

1) FormTracker infers submissions.

2) last_interacted_form_ is Null (otherwise it is not formless)

3.1) formless_elements_were_autofilled_ is true

Or

3.2.a) formless_elements_user_edited_ (set not empty)

And

3.2.b) All edited elements disappeared



This CL adds logic to drop condition 3.2.b) and puts it behind a kill

switch feature flag.



by kill switch

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Post task when dismissing snackbar
entry.content:
Without posting there can be a re-entrancy assert hit when the snackbar

is dismissed. The assert happens because we try to commit a closure that

was already being committed. This doesn't break anything, but we

should defer the snackbar dismissal to avoid this.



I think this started happening due to a recent refactoring that changed

observer triggering order. We shouldn't care about the order observers

are added so posting seems like the right fix.



Bug: 1510742

entry.title: Drm: Commit all CRTC properties in one function
entry.content:
Change HardwareDisplayPlaneManager::CrtcState to store an

absl::optional blob for CTM, DEGAMMA, and GAMMA instead of storing

the blob directly. This way, a single function can be responsible

for committing only the properties that are to change.



This will allow us to move this commit into the page flip (when the

time comes) without hitting the issues in https://crbug.com/854753

caused by unconditionally setting all blobs.

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Fix logic for no-SB warnings vs SB verdict
entry.content:
This fixes a bug in the previous logic for deciding which download

warning to show on the basis of Safe Browsing state of the profile and

the download. Previously we made the incorrect assumption that if the

profile has no SB, then the download must not have an SB verdict. This

is incorrect because the user can turn off SB after the download is

assigned an SB verdict.



The warning that is displayed (i.e. "suspicious" vs "unverified") should

be determined by the presence of the SB verdict primarily, not the SB

state of the profile. This CL switches the order of those checks so that

the warning is primarily determined by the SB verdict, and secondarily

by the state of the profile.



Bug: 1501366

Change-Id: I57244556c29c68262148bcc59db11c49f2c357f2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5123851

Reviewed-by: Xinghui Lu

Commit-Queue: Lily Chen

Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

entry.title: Don't allow reportEvent() to send "reserved.*" events.
entry.content:
When calling `window.fence.reportEvent()` passing in just an eventType

string (i.e. the Private Aggregation path), it properly doesn't allow

sending "reserved.*" events, since those eventTypes should only be used

for automatic beacons. This check was never put in for the

`reportEvent()` path that takes in a FenceEvent. This CL adds that check

in place as well as browser-side verification to match what we do for

the Private Aggregation checks.



This CL also prevents registerAdBeacon() from registering a "reserved.*"

event that isn't already defined as a valid automatic beacon event.



Change-Id: I252a4bfa333f071f5f195c01a2e70cec5e7ec93f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5120095

entry.title: [Proxy SSLConfig 5/7] SSLConfig::alpn_protos in ConnectJobFactory.
entry.content:
Switch to populating SSLConfig::alpn_protos and

SSLConfig::applications_settings in ConnectJobFactory for

the proxy SSLConfig. These were previously populated further up the

stack, but that is not necessary.



Also explicitly disable H2 in ProxyResolvingClientSocketFactory's

HttpNetworkSession. It was passing in empty SSLConfigs, which

implicitly disables H2, but now that ALPN is copied at a lower layer

from the (bogus) HttpNetworkSession, need to disable it on that

HttpNetworkSession direction.



The combination of the last two paragraphs means that we now try to

negotiate HTTP/1.1 via ALPN when a ProxyResolvingClientSocket is

talking to an SSL proxy (We used to send no ALPN protocols in that

case). This should have no user-visible effect.



Bug: 1498285

Change-Id: Ie8ba081d0d3c7f61fb320250a4596245637172d9

password checkup UI.



PasswordCheckupLauncher passes the account email to Java so that the

password checkup for local is shown if account email is empty and

password checkup for the account is shown otherwise.



password_checkup_launcher_helper_impl is a bridge calling into Java.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix `fetchCredentialsForForm:webState:webFrameId:` crash
entry.content:
`fetchCredentialsForForm:webState:webFrameId:` was crashing because we

were accessing the size of a pointer to a vector (`passwordForms`)

without first checking if it was null. This CL fixes the issue by early

returning if passwordForms is null.

entry.title: Deflake color-jpeg-with-color-profile.html on more platforms
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/1237548 added a fuzzy parameter that allowed for

42,401 pixels to be off by up-to 2, which fixed flakiness on mac.

Unfortunately, linux-rel is still flaking with 42,424 pixels different.

This patch ups the totalPixels to allow the entire image to differ by 2

(275 * 207 = 56,925).

entry.title: Add metric tracking time to successfully print documents
entry.content:
Add a metric to track the time taken to submit a print document to the

platform API for printing. If the print document requires conversion

from PDF to another format then this is included in the overall time.



This will be of interest particularly for XPS printing, to illustrate

differences in times from the change in data format conversion.

entry.title: Move UrlRealTime ping logging into RealTimeUrlLookupServiceBase
entry.content:
The UrlRealTimeMechanism is abstracted above the actual network

request. This leads to lost logging in edge cases. Instead, log

directly at the time of the network request/response.



This only has behavior changes for:

- Sampled pings, which previously logged requests and not responses

- Rare race conditions (see bug for full details)



Fixed: 1466912

entry.title: Revert partial low end effects on media playback.
entry.content:
Forcing small buffers on mid range devices is not appropriate,

this will result in more rebuffering for users. It's okay for

true low end devices since they typically have lower resolution

screens which are already limiting playback.

entry.title: Change BufferQueue last displayed buffer
entry.content:
BufferQueue::displayed_buffer_ wouldn't update to nullptr when the last

swap was an empty swap. This isn't accurate since after an empty swap

completes there is no current displayed buffer. Accurately updating is

needed for mac since we can't set buffers as purgeable until they are no

longer displayed.
